alert.note: Alert for Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Niobrara County through 1145 PM MDT... At 1100 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Morrisey, or 23 miles south of Newcastle, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mule Creek Junction and Redbird. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.
